content.text:
An acetal polymer block is fixed to the rigid plates at its top and bottom surfaces. If the top plate displaces 2 mm horizontally when it is subjected to a horizontal force P=2 kN, determine the shear modulus of the polymer. The width of the block is 100 mm. Assume that the polymer is linearly elastic and use small angle analysis. <image 1>

A. 15 MPa
B. 5 MPa
C. 20 MPa
D. 2 MPa

To determine the shear modulus of the acetal polymer, we can use the formula for shear stress and shear strain. The shear stress (\(\tau\)) and shear strain (\(\gamma\)) are related by the shear modulus (\(G\)) as follows:

\[ \tau = G \gamma \]

Given:
- The horizontal force \( P = 2 \, \text{kN} \)
- The width of the block \( b = 100 \, \text{mm} \)
- The displacement of the top plate \( \delta = 2 \, \text{mm} \)
- The height of the block \( h = 200 \, \text{mm} \)

First, we calculate the shear stress (\(\tau\)):

\[ \tau = \frac{P}{b} \]

where \( b \) is the width of the block.

\[ \tau = \frac{2 \, \text{kN}}{100 \, \text{mm}} = \frac{2000 \, \text{N}}{100 \, \text{mm}} = 20 \, \text{N/mm} \]

Next, we calculate the shear strain (\(\gamma\)):

\[ \gamma = \frac{\delta}{h} \]

where \( h \) is the height of the block.

\[ \gamma = \frac{2 \, \text{mm}}{200 \, \text{mm}} = 0.01 \, \text{rad} \]

Now, we can use the shear stress and shear strain to find the shear modulus (\( G \)):

\[ G = \frac{\tau}{\gamma} \]

\[ G = \frac{20 \, \text{N/mm}}{0.01 \, \text{rad}} = 2000 \, \text{N/mm} \cdot \text{rad}^{-1} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N/mm} \cdot \text{rad}^{-1} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{N}}{1 \, \text{kg}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}{1 \, \text{rad}} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N/m} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{kg}}{1 \, \text{N}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}{1 \, \text{rad}} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N/m} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{kg}}{1 \, \text{N}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}{1 \, \text{rad}} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{kg}}{1 \, \text{N}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}{1 \, \text{rad}} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{kg}}{1 \, \text{N}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}{1 \, \text{rad}} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{kg}}{1 \, \text{N}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}{1 \, \text{rad}} \]

\[ G = 2000 \, \text{N} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{kg}}{1 \, \text{N}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{m}}{1000 \, \text{mm}} \cdot \frac{1 \, \text{rad}}
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
